name: Ibis Paris Gare du Nord La Fayette 10eme

reviews.text: It's close to the gare du Nord, which is its best feature. Room OK and rate good, tho: Eur 94 for a single. The sink was blocked and I had to unscrew the sump, which revealed a truly disgusting pile of muck, but the bed was comfortable. Breakfast was pretty grim, in dire surounding, but what do you expect for nine euros? It's better to go to one of the many little restaurants in the area. The staff were cheery and competent, but obviously there's not much money spent on infrastructure. Fine for a night or two.
reviews.title: Cheap and Adequate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don´t expect anything else but cleanliness because it was VERY clean. The room was too small for two people - impossible to take a suitcase to the other side of the room without lifting it over the bed. But as we were just staying overnight it was ok. Reception very kind and helpful. Our room was in the front so if you like to sleep with an open window, forget it. The bed and linen excellent. Just gel/shampoo in the bathroom.
reviews.title: Basic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has no positives except that it is within walk-able distance to the gare du nord station. The room was tiny for the price and unclean. The bathroom had yellow stains on the walls, Internet was very slow and used to disconnect every other minute, shower had some issue with the drain. The state of the hotel made us go out and explore the city more !
reviews.title: below average

reviews.text: The area around the hotel is not entirely comfortable.
reviews.title: Would not recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For a modern hotel, I found the room I was staying in to be very poorly put together. The towels were worn, there was no cover sheet, the window would not close, the internet was not enough, the shower would flood meaning the drain would not drain, there was no outlets to be able to style my hair easily, the bed moved which worried me, the door would not shut all the time properly so I would fight with the handle. The cleaning person was kind and the one day she cleaned she did a good job. There were no wash cloths or hand towels. I guess I am spoiled with previous hotels. I had a hard time finding a cab driver who knew where this hotel was. There was not a good place to pick up a cab close by.
reviews.title: Not up to 3 *** standard!

reviews.text: Overall was not impressed. I have to remind myself that I was only in my room to sleep and to shower but the room I had encouraged me to want to leave as soon as I could because it was not an environment I wanted to stay and enjoy.
reviews.title: Not the best Ibis

reviews.text: Stayed for 5 nights at Ibis Gare du Nord; Overall a decent hotel for the price. Positives: Hotel is very close to Gare du Nord which makes getting around Paris very easy as well as easy access to other parts of Europe and Charles de Gaulle. Staff are very friendly and room was kept clean and tidy. They have 24h room service and 24h bar service if you want. Lots of dining options around the hotel if you want which are not too expensive. Free breakfast is offered every morning. Negatives: The rooms are small and I did not like the bathrooms; there was a bad smell from the toilet and the room felt constantly damp (Im not sure why)- these are personal pet peeves of mine and may be perfectly fine for someone else. The TV also only had one English channel which can get a little boring after a while. The neighborhood is okay but is definitely not St Germain or the true center of Paris and may be a little unsafe late at night. Overall an okay stay.
reviews.title: Overall a decent stay...
Perfectly OK
reviews.text: Good position, walk from Gare du Nord 10 -15 mins. Not the most picturesque area, but ok if to eat nearby, or jump on the Metro and explore.
Nice reception, large really clean and nice room, aircon. Usual IBIS breakfast, nothing hot to eat.
reviews.title: all about location

reviews.text: Why no kettle and teamaking in French hotels, drinking water out of a tap is no fun way to spend my time. I now pack my own kettle if I have space, it makes so much difference.
reviews.title: Quiet good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was satisfying and adequate for our needs. It was at a price we were happy to pay. The staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel provided free internet but, unfortuantely, it was somewhat slow and 15 minutes time-out proved difficult.
reviews.title: Ibis Hotel Gare Du Nord Paris

reviews.text: The reception/lobby area was under renovation but we were not inconvenienced at all
reviews.title: not usual Ibis grade experience

reviews.text: this Ibis property is not usual Ibis grade economy hotels, lacks basic standards in housekeeping and decoration.
reviews.title: Worst Ibis I've stayed in

aka: Ibis Gare Du Nord La Fayette Hotel Paris
description: Ibis Gare Du Nord La Fayette is in the heart of Paris. Only 2 minutes from Gare Du Nord station and close to Gare De L Est, the Opera House, Montmartre and the Olympia. There is a direct RER train link to the Parc de Villepinte Convention Centre, the airport and Le Stade De France. Book one of our 70 airconditioned rooms with WiFi access (incl. 3 for guests with limited mobility) and make use of our bar, 24 hour snack service, garden and public undercover pay parking. Restaurants nearby. Pets allowed.
